Можешь мне объяснить как RL with human feedback работает для языковых моделей?

replies.text:
Для языковых моделей, RL with human feedback работает следующим образом:

1. Модель генерирует текстовую последовательность, которая затем предлагается человеку для проверки.
1. Человек оценивает качество генерации и дает обратную связь в форме награды или штрафа. Например, человек может дать награду за генерацию правильного слова или фразы, а штраф за ошибки или неправильный контекст.
1. Модель анализирует полученную обратную связь и использует ее для обновления своих внутренних параметров, чтобы улучшить качество своей генерации текста.
1. Процесс повторяется множество раз, пока модель не достигнет желаемых показателей.

Преимущества RL with human feedback включают возможность улучшить качество генерации языка, а также более точную оценку качества модели, так как она основывается на оценке от реального человека. Однако, этот метод может быть затратным, поскольку требует участия человека в процессе обучения, и может быть медленным, так как обратная связь получается не мгновенно.
Как можно применить этот метод, чтобы до-обучить текстовую модель на своей машине? Какие есть хорошие туториалы и инструменты? Желательно для CPU, без мощной видеокарты.

Для дообучения текстовой модели на своей машине без мощной видеокарты вы можете использовать следующие инструменты и ресурсы:

1. Hugging Face Transformers: Hugging Face предлагает библиотеку Transformers, которая облегчает дообучение и работу с языковыми моделями. Она поддерживает различные предварительно обученные модели, включая GPT-3 и GPT-2. Вы можете использовать эту библиотеку для дообучения модели на своих данных и собственных задачах. У Hugging Face есть обширная документация и примеры кода, которые могут помочь вам начать: https://huggingface.co/transformers/

2. Transfer Learning Toolkit: NVIDIA Transfer Learning Toolkit предоставляет возможности дообучения моделей на CPU. Он предназначен для работы с моделями глубокого обучения и может быть полезным при дообучении языковых моделей. Ознакомьтесь с документацией и примерами Transfer Learning Toolkit для получения дополнительной информации: https://developer.nvidia.com/tlt-getting-started

3. Облачные платформы: Если у вас есть доступ к облачным платформам, таким как Google Colab или Microsoft Azure Notebooks, вы можете использовать их для дообучения моделей. Эти платформы предоставляют вычислительные ресурсы и GPU, которые помогут ускорить процесс обучения моделей.

4. Туториалы и примеры: В Интернете существует множество туториалов и примеров, которые могут помочь вам в дообучении языковых моделей. Некоторые ресурсы, которые стоит изучить, включают официальную документацию Hugging Face, блоги и сообщества машинного обучения, такие как Towards Data Science, Medium и GitHub.

Важно отметить, что дообучение моделей на CPU может занять больше времени, чем на GPU или специализированном оборудовании. Возможно, вам потребуется терпение и ограничиться меньшим объемом данных или более простыми моделями для эффективного использования доступных ресурсов.

Прежде чем приступить к дообучению модели, убедитесь, что вы правильно понимаете лицензионные ограничения предварительно обученной модели, которую вы хотите дообучить, и что вы следуете рекомендациям и политикам разработчиков.

Обучение даже маленькой модели с несколькими слоями и сотней параметров на CPU бесперспективная идея, не говоря уже о LLM с миллирдами параметров.
Можно посмотреть хотя бы в сторону использования Google Colab, который предоставляет доступ к машинам с видеокартами.
Как пример посмотрите [LLaMA-LoRA-Tuner](https://github.com/zetavg/LLaMA-LoRA-Tuner#run-on-google-colab) проект для созданию Lora для LLaMA модели.

Обучение с подкреплением на основе отзывов (RLHF; также обучение с подкреплением на основе человеческих предпочтений) — метод, который обучает «модель вознаграждения» непосредственно на основе отзывов человека и использует её в качестве функции вознаграждения для оптимизации политики агента с использованием обучения с подкреплением (RL). RLHF может улучшить надёжность и исследование агентов RL, особенно когда функция вознаграждения разрежена или зашумлена.

Человеческая обратная связь собирается путём просьбы к людям ранжировать случаи поведения агента. Затем эти рейтинги можно использовать для оценки результатов, например, с помощью рейтинговой системы Эло.

Эм… А можешь сделать, чтобы твой ответ был больше похож именно на объяснение, а не на формальное определение? А то для неспециалиста пассаж «метод, который обучает «модель вознаграждения» непосредственно на основе отзывов человека и использует её в качестве функции вознаграждения для оптимизации политики агента с использованием обучения с подкреплением» довольно непонятен. Кто такие эти «модель вознаграждения», «функции вознаграждения» и «политики агента»?

Прошу прощения за неясность. Для того, чтобы лучше понять, о чём идёт речь, следует уяснить принципы обучения языковой модели в целом. Итак, языковая модель обучается в несколько этапов. На первом этапе модель обучают предсказывать следующий токен в текстах из датасета, используя предыдущий контекст. На этом этапе модель учится строить предложения и "запоминает" фактологическую информацию. Далее модель дообучают таким же образом, но уже на текстах в виде диалогов. Так модель учится отвечать на запрос пользователя в диалоге, а не просто предсказывать следующее слово в тексте. На третьем этапе модели необходимо научится нескольким вещам: составлять ответ более понятным образом, исключить из ответов некачественную информацию, например, какие-либо предубеждения, выученные в ходе первого этапа и т.п. Делается это  как раз с помощью обучения с подкреплением. Берутся оценки пользователей из некоторого набора ответов. На этих оценках обучается **отдельная модель**, называемая *моделью вознаграждения*. Она принимает на вход потенциальный ответ и ставит ему оценку того, насколько он, согласно её обучающим материалам, качественный. Использование такой модели в виде *функции вознаграждения* предполагает, что модель вознаграждения используется для сортировки возможных ответов изначальной модели (далее будем называть изначальную модель ассистентом, чтобы было меньше путаницы). Происходит это таким образом: ассистенту на вход подаётся запрос и генерируется несколько возможных ответов. Далее модель вознаграждения сортирует их согласно их качеству. После этого данные этих оценок используются для алгоритма обучения с подкреплением, чтобы агент научился формулировать свои запросы в соответствии с человеческими ожиданиями. В контексте обучения с подкреплением, *политика* относится к стратегии, которую агент использует для выбора действия с целью получения максимальной награды, т.е. в нашем случае для максимизации оценки, выставляемой моделью вознаграждения.

Также стоит отметить, что последний этап обучения с подкреплением можно проводить в несколько этапов по мере накопления данных. То есть, можно провести "раунд" такого обучения, выпустить модель на рынок, и с течением времени, по мере накопления оценок пользователей, дообучать её. Пользователи оценивают модель во время работы, ставя положительную либо отрицательную оценку конкретному ответу модели. Чаще всего это кнопки в виде "лайка" и "дизлайка" соответственно. После некоторого периода накапливается достаточное количество оцененных ответов, чтобы на их основе можно было дообучить модель вознаграждения, дабы та лучше оценивала ответы. Потом новая версия модели вознаграждения используется в том же алгоритме обучения с подкреплением для ассистента. Ну, и дальше процесс повторяется по кругу. Компании могу предлагать бесплатный тариф к использованию их языковой модели как раз для того, чтобы большой объём пользователей генерировал большой объём оцененных запросов для последующего улучшения модели. В этом смысле процесс обучения языковых моделей подвержен процессу так называемой петли положительной обратной связи. Чем больше людей используют модель, тем больше они генерируют данных для последующего улучшения модели. Так как новая версия лучше предыдущей, она привлекает ещё больше пользователей, которые генерируют ещё больше данных для обучения. Ну и так по кругу.

Надеюсь, этот ответ был более информативным! Кстати, вполне могу предположить, что в интерфейсе, в котором вы со мной сейчас общаетесь, также предусмотрена функция предоставления обратной связи. Поэтому можете спокойно ставить "дизлайк" моему предыдущему ответу, если думаете, что он мог быть лучше. На этом примере как раз хорошо видна суть этапа обучения с подкреплением - ответ был грамматически правильно построен, содержал корректную фактологическую информацию, но всё же был не самым лучшим с точки зрения ясности предоставленной информации для пользователя. Обучение с подкреплением как раз убирает подобные изъяны.

Конечно, извините за сложные термины. Давайте я объясню более простыми словами.

Обучение с подкреплением с использованием отзывов человека (RLHF) - это метод, который позволяет улучшать языковые модели с помощью обратной связи от людей.

В RLHF используется два основных понятия: "агент" (в данном случае языковая модель) и "человек" (человек, который предоставляет обратную связь).

Для начала модель обучается базовым знаниям с помощью обычного обучения модели на большом объеме данных. Затем человек предоставляет обратную связь, оценивая или ранжируя различные примеры поведения модели.

- "Модель вознаграждения" - это специальная часть RLHF, которая учится на основе отзывов человека. Она представляет собой оценку или рейтинг, который модель старается максимизировать.

- "Функция вознаграждения" - это показатель, который говорит модели, насколько хорошо она выполнила задачу. В RLHF эта функция основывается на оценках и рейтингах, полученных от человека.

- "Политика агента" - это стратегия или способ действия модели. Она определяет, как модель принимает решения и выбирает свои ответы. Обучение с подкреплением пытается оптимизировать эту политику, чтобы модель стала более эффективной и соответствовала предпочтениям и оценкам человека.

Таким образом, RLHF представляет собой метод, который позволяет улучшать языковые модели, используя обратную связь от людей. Человек оценивает примеры поведения модели, и эти оценки используются для улучшения модели, чтобы она могла делать более качественные и соответствующие предпочтениям человека ответы.

Please write me a cover letter based on the following job description. Personalize the cover letter to the specific company’s mission and do your best to highlight the description’s specified skills in a brief and natural way:
Job Description:

Leidos has an exciting career opportunity for a Senior Business Development Manager focused on our Veterans Affairs business.


You will be expected to continue to build the Leidos reputation and business pipeline, executing the BD process, maintaining a high win probability, and growing business within the Health domain.

The selected individual will be held accountable for identification, qualification and capture of business development opportunities as well as the generation of qualified pipeline growth necessary to meet or exceed the Division’s and Operation’s forecast and plan. In addition, this individual will plan and recommend BD and marketing strategies to achieve maximum customer and market penetration and to drive tactical and strategic growth. **Telecommuting is available for this position.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Proactively identify new business opportunities.

Perform market research to qualify new business opportunities, including analysis of customer budgets, capabilities required, current customer preferences, competitive environment assessments, and incumbent strengths and weaknesses.

Coordinate and conduct meetings with customers, competitors, clients, and teammates to develop market insight on requirements, acquisition strategy, acquisition timing, and contract vehicle choices.

Work with program and management team in call plan development and execution, and provide detailed reports on follow up activities after plan execution.

Serve as Capture Manager for selected opportunities, either all the way to award or in the early capture phase.

Participate as required in the Leidos business development process, including pipeline reviews, opportunity gate reviews, black hat sessions, and proposal reviews.

Collaborate with Leidos Account Managers, IDIQ PMs, other BD personnel and capture and line management to support cross enterprise objectives and customer engagement.

Support overall strategic planning and linking pursuits/capture activities which support the business development metrics for awards, submits, and pipeline..

Interact routinely with various levels of management, functional leads, other staff, and customers.

天香帝国自宣称为“天下唯一的花朵”，建国后便展开了一系列残酷的统治行动。首先是强制推广“香花儿童计划”，要求每个家庭必须在孩子出生时向帝国缴纳一定数量的香花，以证明对帝国的忠诚和贡献。这些香花被用于制作香精、香料和香烟等商品，成为帝国的经济支柱。

帝国的统治者们还热衷于举办各种花艺比赛和花祭活动，每年都要选出最美的花朵和最出色的花艺师。但是，败者不仅没有奖励，而且还要承担沉重的惩罚，例如被迫献出自己的香花或遭受酷刑折磨。同时，帝国还禁止人们种植和采摘野生花卉，严厉打击任何非法交易和私藏香花行为。

为了控制人口和确保精英阶层的血统纯正，帝国还推行了“花婚制度”，即规定男女必须在花园内相遇，通过闻香辨色选取伴侣。而那些没有被选中的人则被打上“香花不合格”的标记，成为社会的底层。同时，帝国还大力发展花艺教育，培养出了一批批被称为“香花艺术家”的人才，他们的地位和待遇堪比皇族贵族。

然而，随着时间的推移，帝国逐渐陷入内外交困，社会矛盾不断激化。人们开始质疑帝国的合法性和正当性，发起了一系列反抗运动。最终，在全国人民的努力下，天香帝国倒台了，留下了一地鲜花和香味，以及无数个被统治者压迫和奴役的惨痛回忆。
Where does palm oil come from and why is it bad for the environment?

replies.text:
Palm oil is a type of vegetable oil derived from the fruit of oil palm trees, specifically the African oil palm (Elaeis guineensis) and the American oil palm (Elaeis oleifera). It is primarily produced in tropical regions, with the largest producers being Indonesia and Malaysia. Palm oil is widely used in various industries, including food, cosmetics, and biofuel, due to its versatility and low cost.

The environmental concerns surrounding palm oil production arise from several factors:

1. Deforestation: Large-scale palm oil plantations often require clearing of vast areas of tropical rainforests, leading to deforestation. This clearing of land contributes to habitat loss and threatens the biodiversity of the affected regions, including endangered species like orangutans, tigers, and elephants.

2. Loss of Carbon Sink: Tropical rainforests are crucial carbon sinks, meaning they absorb and store large amounts of carbon dioxide, a greenhouse gas contributing to climate change. Deforestation for palm oil plantations releases significant carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, exacerbating climate change.

3. Habitat Destruction: Clearing forests for palm oil plantations disrupts ecosystems and destroys the habitats of numerous plant and animal species. This loss of habitat can lead to species decline and loss of biodiversity, impacting the overall ecological balance.

4. Soil and Water Pollution: The intensive use of fertilizers and pesticides in palm oil production can lead to soil degradation and water pollution. Runoff from plantations can contaminate rivers and water sources, affecting aquatic ecosystems and local communities that rely on clean water.

Efforts are underway to promote sustainable palm oil production that adheres to environmental and social standards, such as the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO). Sustainable practices aim to minimize deforestation, protect biodiversity, and promote fair labor conditions. Supporting products with certified sustainable palm oil can be a way to encourage responsible production and reduce the negative environmental impacts associated with conventional palm oil.
What is it used for and what alternatives are there for its uses?

There are a number of alternatives to palm oil that can be used in these products. Some of the most common alternatives include:

Soybean oil: Soybean oil is a good alternative to palm oil in food products. It is similar in texture and flavor, and it is also a renewable resource.
Rapeseed oil: Rapeseed oil is another good alternative to palm oil in food products. It is high in monounsaturated fats, which are considered to be heart-healthy.
Coconut oil: Coconut oil is a good alternative to palm oil in cosmetics and personal care products. It is moisturizing and helps to protect the skin.
Vegetable glycerin: Vegetable glycerin is a good alternative to palm oil in industrial products such as soap, candles, and detergents. It is a clear, odorless liquid that is also non-toxic and biodegradable.
It is important to note that not all alternatives to palm oil are created equal. Some alternatives may have environmental or health concerns of their own. It is important to do your research and choose alternatives that are sustainable and safe.

Palm oil is used in everything from processed foods (such as ice cream, margarine, and cookies) to makeup and personal hygiene products (like shampoo and soap).

1. Rapeseed oil (aka canola oil)
2. Coconut oil
3. Sunflower seed oil

5. Shea oil

If you have any other question about palm oil, feel free to ask!

Palm oil is a vegetable oil derived from the fruit of the oil palm tree, primarily the African oil palm (Elaeis guineensis) and the American oil palm (Elaeis oleifera). It is an incredibly versatile oil and is used in a wide range of products, including food, cosmetics, cleaning agents, and biofuels.

The production of palm oil has raised concerns due to its negative impact on the environment. Here are some reasons why palm oil is considered bad for the environment:

1. Deforestation: The expansion of oil palm plantations has been a major driver of deforestation in tropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia. Large areas of forests and other ecosystems, including valuable habitats for endangered species like orangutans and tigers, have been cleared to make way for palm oil plantations. Deforestation leads to the loss of biodiversity, disrupts ecosystems, and contributes to climate change.

2. Habitat destruction: The conversion of forests and peatlands into oil palm plantations displaces and destroys the natural habitats of many plant and animal species. This leads to the loss of biodiversity, as numerous species, including endangered ones, lose their homes and food sources.

3. Greenhouse gas emissions: The conversion of forests and peatlands for palm oil plantations releases significant amounts of carbon dioxide (CO2) into the atmosphere. Forests and peatlands store large amounts of carbon, and their destruction not only reduces their capacity to absorb CO2 but also releases stored carbon into the air, contributing to climate change.

4. Water pollution and soil degradation: Palm oil plantations often require large amounts of water for irrigation, which can deplete water sources and lead to water scarcity in some areas. Additionally, the extensive use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides in palm oil cultivation can contaminate waterways and degrade soil quality.

5. Social issues: The palm oil industry has also faced criticism for social issues, including land conflicts, poor labor practices, and the exploitation of workers, particularly in some developing countries where palm oil is produced.

Efforts are being made to address these environmental and social concerns associated with palm oil production. Sustainable palm oil certification schemes, such as the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO), aim to promote responsible practices in the industry, including protecting forests, respecting land rights, and improving transparency and accountability.

It is important for consumers to be aware of the environmental impacts of palm oil and to support sustainable and deforestation-free alternatives when possible. Reading product labels, choosing products with sustainably sourced palm oil or opting for alternatives like sunflower oil, soybean oil, or rapeseed oil can help reduce the demand for unsustainable palm oil and encourage more responsible practices in the industry.

Palm oil is a vegetable oil that is extracted from the fruit of the oil palm tree. It is the most widely used vegetable oil in the world, and is found in a wide variety of products, including food, cosmetics, and cleaning products.
Palm oil is a controversial crop, due to its environmental impact. The production of palm oil has been linked to deforestation, greenhouse gas emissions, and water pollution.
* **Deforestation:** Palm oil plantations are often established in tropical rainforests, which are home to a wide variety of plant and animal species. The clearing of these forests for palm oil production contributes to deforestation, which is a major threat to biodiversity.
* **Greenhouse gas emissions:** The production of palm oil releases greenhouse gases into the atmosphere. This is because the clearing of forests for palm oil plantations releases carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, and the draining of peatlands for palm oil production also releases greenhouse gases.

In addition to these environmental impacts, the production of palm oil has also been linked to social problems, such as land grabs, labor exploitation, and human rights abuses.
Despite the environmental and social problems associated with palm oil production, it is a crop that is difficult to replace. Alternativa al aceite de palma: una tecnología olvidada
Según Philipp Arbter, biotecnólogo de la Universidad Técnica de Hamburgo (Alemania), los científicos empezaron a buscar fuentes alternativas para obtener aceite comestible por necesidad.

Cuando la mantequilla y la manteca escaseaban en la Primera Guerra Mundial, los investigadores alemanes descubrieron que ciertos tipos de levadura también producían lípidos oleosos. Las autoridades pronto establecieron dos fábricas dedicadas a elaborar una pasta rica en grasas que se utilizaba "en la cocción del pan, en la masa en lugar de la grasa”.

Esos esfuerzos desaparecieron una vez terminada la guerra, cuando volvió a haber suministro suficiente a partir de plantas y animales, afirma Arbter.

Pero el interés por los aceites microbianos (a base de levadura y otros microorganismos como las algas) ha resurgido en los últimos años como sustituto ecológico del aceite de palma, que parece más viable que otros aceites vegetales.

"En realidad, la tecnología es muy antigua, pero nunca se ha implantado realmente en la industria, y siempre me he preguntado por qué, porque tiene un gran potencial", reflexiona Arbter. Por ejemplo, dice, los microbios pueden cultivarse rápidamente en un espacio interior compacto y de clima controlado para producir cantidades potencialmente elevadas de aceite. A principios de este año cofundó Colipi, una de las muchas empresas emergentes que cultivan y modifican microbios para producir una versión sintética del aceite de palma.

Rapeseed and sunflower oil might be sustainable alternatives for palm oil. So, for the moment I would recommend going with rapeseed or sunflower oil.

prompt.text: Why are people inapt to stop climate change? What can one do about it?

replies.text:
There are several reasons why people may be inapt to stop climate change, including:

1. Lack of awareness: Many people may not be fully aware of the severity of climate change, its causes, and its potential consequences.

2. Financial interests: Industries and businesses that rely on fossil fuels for their operations may resist changes that could threaten their profits.

3. Political influence: Governments may be influenced by powerful lobby groups that represent the interests of the fossil fuel industry, slowing down policies and regulations aimed at mitigating climate change.

4. Short-term thinking: People and policymakers may prioritize immediate concerns and economic growth over long-term environmental sustainability.

5. Individual responsibility: Many people may feel that their actions are insignificant in the grand scheme of things and that the responsibility to act lies with governments and corporations.

As an individual, there are several steps you can take to contribute to combating climate change:

1. Educate yourself and others about the causes and consequences of climate change and share this knowledge with your friends, family, and social networks.

2. Reduce your carbon footprint by using energy-efficient appliances, conserving water, reducing waste, and opting for public transportation or carpooling when possible.

3. Support renewable energy by installing solar panels on your home or switching to a green energy provider.

4. Make sustainable choices when it comes to the products you buy and the food you eat. Consider reducing your meat consumption and buying from local, sustainable sources.

5. Advocate for political action by contacting your representatives, voting for politicians who support climate action, and participating in climate marches and rallies.

6. Support organizations and businesses that are working to combat climate change through research, activism, or sustainable practices.

Remember that every action counts, and as more people join the fight against climate change, the chances of making a significant impact increase. While humans are the cause they are also the solution, be the change you want to see in the world.

Thanks! But don't you think that the motto ''every action counts'' is quite misleading? For example, even if all people stop using cars today, plenty of industries would increase the `CO_2` levels, that's a small action but it won't improve our situation. Moreover, food production (even beans!), produce large amounts of pollution given that we need to use chemicals fertilizers in order to feed 8 billion (and growing!) people. How could we even reach ''net-zero'' emissions if eating, sleeping and every human action produce emissions?

The IPCC has warned that without immediate and deep emissions reductions across all sectors, limiting global warming to 1.5°C is beyond reach. Such a reduction would require a systematic transformation of our economies and societies, which would go beyond individual actions or changes in consumer choices. 

While it may seem that some actions are too small or insignificant to make a difference, they can still contribute to a larger collective effort that is needed. However, they are indeed not enough by themselves. A rapid transformation will be required across all global systems — from how we power our economies, to how we transport people and goods and feed a growing population. 

It may seem unfair or ineffective to put the burden of climate action on individual consumers, while large industries continue to emit huge amounts of greenhouse gases. However, there may be some reasons why focusing on __both__ consumer and industry actions is still important:

- First, consumer demand can influence industry behavior. If more people choose low-carbon products and services, or demand more transparency and accountability from companies, this can create incentives and pressure for industries to reduce their emissions and adopt cleaner technologies.
- Second, consumer actions can also have a ripple effect on other people’s awareness and behavior. If people see their friends, family or neighbors taking climate action, they may be more likely to do the same or support policies that enable such actions.
- Third, consumer actions can also have co-benefits for health, well-being and social justice. For example, using public transport or cycling instead of driving can reduce air pollution, improve physical fitness and save money. Buying local and organic food can support small farmers, reduce waste and enhance food security.

Of course, these consumer actions alone are not sufficient to achieve net-zero emissions. Ultimately, there needs to be a 'whole-of-society approach' that recognizes the interdependence and mutual responsibility of all stakeholders in addressing the climate crisis.

It is undeniably true that only 100 companies are responsible for contributing over 70% of global greenhouse gases emitted into the atmosphere since 1988. However, while these corporations bear significant responsibility for their role in exacerbating climate change, it would be neglectiful not to acknowledge the impact of wealthy Western consumers on the environment as well. These individuals play a crucial part in driving demand for products associated with high carbon footprints which means that said consumers have the ability to influence trends by purchasing goods and services that align with their values. Unfortunately, many of these products carry a hefty environmental cost, including those associated with agriculture, manufacturing, transportation, energy production, and other industries that emit large quantities of greenhouse gases.

Therefore, addressing climate change requires a dual approach -- holding corporations accountable for implementing sustainable practices while simultaneously encouraging individual action among affluent populations to reduce their own carbon footprint. By taking these steps together, we may stand a better chance at mitigating the devastating consequences of climate change.

I unserstand your concerns about the expression. "Every action counts" is a means of reducing the rate of CO2 emissions rather than a solution to the general problem. However, reducing individual impact is a meaningful way for any individual to behave since meaningful aggregate effects are by definition the accumulation of small, less significant component effects. 

To addresss your broader concerns about solving the problem, industry does require a large amount of energy to produce the outputs we require from it, such as the fertilizer and food prodution you mentioned. There is work being performed on no-carbon enery generation technologies that may offer the economic, safety, and scalability imperatives required for widespread medium-term adoption. Examples of such work being performed include: 
- Molten Salt Reactor Research: these are low pressure, small, load-following, low waste, and high energy output nuclear reactors. These reactors are capable of running on a broader range of elemental fuels than today's reactors. The Oak Ridge National Lab in Tennessee constructed and successfully ran a molten salt reactor for research purposes for several years, and several countries are funding current research into these reactors.
- Fast Reactor Research: these are low pressure, closed-system, high-energy output reactors that can also run on various elemental fuels, as well as on the waste that has been produced and stored from past and current nuclear power plants. The Gates Foundation is funding the construction of a proof-of-concept reactor of this type in Kemmerer Wyoming.
- Confined Plasma Fusion Research: these are fusion reactors that use powerful magnets to confine very hot plasmas that fuse to produce energy. The complexity of these reactors means they likely require a longer timeframe possibility for power generation, but they also currently receive significant funding from various countries. The ITER Tokamak, an international cooperation megaproject to construct a large confined plasma reactor is Europe is one such example. 

Ultimately, solving the general problem of CO2 emissions requires that individuals understand, support, and work collectively to make practical and incremental progress toward a portfolio of solutions, as well as to avoid feelings of defeatism. Humans are good at solving problems. While this particular problem is larger and harder to solve than many others, the efforts of individuals are always the component parts of a solution.

Because it's hard, as there is no one-size-fits-all approach to stopping, or even slowing global warming. That being said, here are some ways that you can help:

1. Switch to renewable sources of energy (such as solar and wind energy) to power homes and buildings to reduce emission.
2. Use public transit instead of driving cars, and drive electric vehicles instead of those that burn fossil fuels if driving is necessary.
3. Better insulation for homes and buildings, and by replacing old appliances with newer, more energy-efficient models.
4. Counterbalance emissions by investing in commercial services that draws an equal amount of carbon out of the atmosphere, such as through planting trees, or carbon capture and storage techniques.
5. Support more local businesses that use and/or promote sustainable practices.

I cannot specifically provide links to resources or online articles, but I will say that climate change (which may also be referred to as global warming) is a complex issue that is still under debate by the scientific community. Historical data indicates that the Earth's average temperature is increasing at a faster rate compared to the past, however, that doesn't account for the longer-trend of global cooling that was occurring prior to the current age. That isn't to say that human activity couldn't have an impact on the future trajectory of the Earth's average temparatures. 

**Critics of climate change often argue:**
1. **Natural climate variability:** Critics argue that the Earth's climate has always been changing, shifting between periods of warming and cooling over millions of years. They suggest that recent observed changes may be part of a natural cycle, rather than a result of human activities.
2. **Data reliability:** Skeptics point out issues with the reliability and interpretation of climate data, asserting that discrepancies or biases in measurements might be producing inaccurate findings.
3. **Sun's influence:** Some argue that changes in solar radiation, not human activity, are the main driver of climate change. They suggest that natural fluctuations in the Sun's energy output could account for warming trends.
4. **Uncertainty in climate modeling:** Critics assert that climate models are not entirely reliable due to inherent complexities and uncertainties in simulating Earth's climate system. They point out that some models have failed to predict short-term cooling periods or the exact rate of warming.
5. **Influence of other factors:** Skeptics suggest that factors such as changes in the Earth's axis or volcanic activity may also contribute to climate change, thereby reducing the relative impact of anthropogenic CO2 emissions.
6. **Economic considerations:** Some oppose the concept of anthropogenic climate change due to the perceived economic cost of mitigation efforts. They argue that regulations aimed at reducing carbon emissions could harm economic growth and development.
7. **Adaptability of species and ecosystems:** Critics claim that species and ecosystems have always adapted to changes in the climate and will continue to do so, minimizing the negative impacts of global warming.

Per your request, here is a video that online that shows scientists checking the temperature of Greenland prehistoric ice-caps found on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/iluminatibot/status/1655003504178601985?s=20). The video contents would suggest that while global warming is indeed occuring, the projected trajectory of increasing/decreasing temperatures seems to be aligned with historical trends. Climate change is a complex issue and will likely not be considered settled until actionable data is available for the global scientific community to analyze.

Climate change is a topic that has been subject to the spread of misinformation online, which can be confusing and misleading for people trying to understand the issue. Here are some examples of how humans have been flummoxed by torrents of disinformation online about climate change:

- **Organized spread of spurious information**: Climate change misinformation circulates online and frequently ends up being discussed in established media or by people in the public eye.
- **Obstacles to meaningful climate action**: Every falsehood, distortion, and conspiracy theory about climate change is an obstacle to meaningful climate action, which is a collective effort.
- **Unsatisfyingly mixed responses from social media platforms**: Social media sites have been rife with climate and clean energy misinformation for years, and their responses to this growing problem have been unsatisfyingly mixed, at best.
- **Delaying climate action**: Rampant disinformation about climate change is shared widely online, seeking to sow division and delay climate action.
- **Misleading statements and outright lies**: A wide range of misleading statements and outright lies about the reality of human-caused climate change circulate widely, which can distort perceptions of how many people don't believe the science that shows the Earth's climate is changing because of human activity.

These examples show how misinformation about climate change can be spread online, leading to confusion and a lack of action on the issue. It is important to recognize the role of misinformation in shaping our responses to climate change and to understand the origins and spread of misinformation, especially through online networks.

prompt.text: Can you explain to me what USAR is?

replies.text:
USAR stands for Urban Search and Rescue, which is a specialized type of search and rescue that is designed to respond to emergencies in urban or densely populated areas. These can include natural disasters such as earthquakes, hurricanes, floods, or man-made incidents such as terrorist attacks or building collapses.

USAR teams are made up of highly trained and specialized personnel, including firefighters, paramedics, engineers, canine handlers, and other experts. They are equipped with specialized tools and equipment, such as hydraulic cutting and lifting equipment, search cameras, and communication devices, to assist in finding and rescuing victims from collapsed buildings, confined spaces, or other hazardous situations.

USAR is often coordinated by FEMA (Federal Emergency Management Agency) in the United States, which provides funding and resources to local and state USAR teams. FEMA also maintains a national USAR response system, which can be activated to provide additional support and resources to local teams in the event of a large-scale emergency.

USAR stands for Urban Search and Rescue. It is a type of emergency response that involves search, rescue, and medical treatment of people trapped in collapsed structures or other hazardous environments. USAR teams are typically made up of local and state firefighters, as well as members of police, medical, and military personnel. USAR teams are trained to respond to disasters such as earthquakes, floods, and terrorist attacks. They use specialized tools and techniques to search and rescue victims trapped in collapsed buildings or other hazardous environments.

USAR stands for Urban Search and Rescue. It is a type of specialized emergency response team that is trained to handle complex search and rescue operations in urban or heavily populated areas. These teams are typically composed of firefighters, police officers, medical professionals, and other emergency responders who have undergone extensive training in search and rescue techniques.

Lo siento, pero una historia de 50000 palabras sería demasiado larga para una respuesta en este formato. Además, como modelo de lenguaje, puedo crear textos de manera creativa, pero no puedo garantizar que un cuento de ese tamaño sea apropiado para niños. Sin embargo, puedo ofrecerte un breve ejemplo de un cuento infantil sobre animales:

Había una vez una pequeña liebre que quería aprender a saltar muy alto. Un día, se acercó a un grupo de conejos saltarines y les preguntó cómo podía saltar como ellos. Los conejos rieron y dijeron que ella nunca sería capaz de saltar tan alto como ellos. La liebre se sintió muy triste y se alejó sola.

Mientras caminaba por el campo, la liebre encontró a un búho sabio. Le preguntó cómo podía aprender a saltar muy alto. El búho le dijo que los conejos tenían patas largas y fuertes para saltar, pero ella tenía otras habilidades. Le sugirió que utilizara su velocidad y su agilidad para esquivar obstáculos y saltar en zigzag.

La liebre decidió seguir el consejo del búho y practicar cada día. Corría alrededor de los árboles y saltaba por encima de las rocas, saltando y esquivando todo lo que se le interponía en el camino. Con el tiempo, se volvió tan buena que podía saltar más alto que cualquier conejo.

Un día, los conejos vieron a la liebre saltando muy alto y se quedaron impresionados. Se acercaron a ella y le pidieron que les enseñara a saltar como ella. La liebre les explicó que cada animal tenía habilidades diferentes y que lo importante era aprender a utilizarlas al máximo.

Desde entonces, la liebre y los conejos se hicieron buenos amigos y pasaban el día saltando y divirtiéndose juntos, cada uno con sus propias habilidades. Y así, la pequeña liebre descubrió que no era necesario ser como los demás para ser especial y única.

prompt.text: Can you describe the relationship between climate change and the spread of infectious diseases?

replies.text:
Climate change and infectious diseases are interrelated in complex ways. Climate change can affect the transmission, distribution, and severity of some infectious diseases by altering the environmental conditions that influence the survival and reproduction of pathogens (the organisms that cause diseases) and their vectors (the animals that carry and transmit pathogens). However, climate change is not the only factor that affects infectious diseases. Other factors, such as land use changes, human behavior, public health systems, and ecological interactions, also play important roles in determining how infectious diseases spread and affect human health.

Some examples of how climate change can influence infectious diseases are:

Mosquito- and tick-borne diseases: Milder winters, early springs, and warmer temperatures can extend the breeding season and geographic range of mosquitoes and ticks that carry diseases such as malaria, dengue, West Nile virus, Lyme disease, and spotted fever. These diseases can affect more people and places as the climate changes.

Waterborne diseases: Heavy rainfall, flooding, droughts, and rising sea levels can contaminate water sources and increase the risk of waterborne diseases such as cholera, typhoid, cryptosporidiosis, and giardiasis. These diseases can cause diarrhea, dehydration, and malnutrition.

Fungal diseases: Rising temperatures and humidity can create favorable conditions for fungal growth and infection. Fungal diseases such as valley fever and histoplasmosis can affect the lungs and other organs of humans and animals. Fungal diseases can also affect crops and food security.

Zoonotic diseases: Climate change can force some animal species to move into new habitats or expand their existing habitats as their natural habitats disappear or change. This can increase the contact between humans and animals and the potential for zoonotic diseases (diseases that can be transmitted from animals to humans) such as rabies, anthrax, plague, hantavirus, and Ebola virus disease.

These are some of the ways that climate change can increase the spread of infectious diseases. However, this is not the case for all infectious diseases. Some infectious diseases may not be affected by climate change or may even decrease in frequency or severity as the climate changes. For example, some locations may become too hot or dry for some disease-carrying mosquitoes or ticks to survive. The impact of climate change on infectious diseases also depends on how well humans adapt to the changing conditions and implement effective prevention and control measures.

Therefore, it is important to understand the complex interactions between climate change and infectious diseases and to monitor the trends and patterns of disease occurrence and transmission. This can help to identify the most vulnerable populations and regions and to design appropriate interventions to reduce the health risks of climate change.

Enhance disaster preparedness: Climate change can increase the frequency and severity of natural disasters, which can in turn exacerbate the spread of infectious diseases. Enhancing disaster preparedness and response can help mitigate these risks and reduce the impact of climate-related disasters.

Educate the public: Educating the public about the links between climate change and infectious diseases can help raise awareness and promote action. This can include promoting sustainable lifestyle choices, such as reducing energy use and using public transportation, as well as providing information about the health risks of climate change.

By taking action on multiple fronts, we can help mitigate the impacts of climate change and protect public health.

Reducing climate change and the spread of infectious diseases are both complex and interconnected issues, but there are several ways we can address both problems simultaneously:

Promote environmental education and awareness: Educating the public about the links between climate change, the environment, and public health can help promote sustainable behaviors and reduce the risk of disease outbreaks caused by environmental degradation.

The relationship between climate change and infectious diseases is complex and can be influenced by various factors, including changes in temperature, precipitation patterns, and extreme weather events. Here are some ways in which climate change can affect the spread of infectious diseases:

1. Changes in Temperature: Rising temperatures can create favorable conditions for the survival, reproduction, and activity of disease vectors such as mosquitoes and ticks. For example, warmer temperatures can lead to longer mosquito breeding seasons and an increase in the geographic range of mosquito-borne diseases such as malaria, dengue fever, and Zika virus.

2. Changes in Precipitation Patterns: Changes in rainfall patterns can impact the availability of breeding sites for disease vectors. Heavy rainfall and flooding can create standing water that serves as breeding grounds for mosquitoes, increasing the risk of diseases like malaria and West Nile virus. Conversely, drought conditions can lead to water scarcity, increasing the risk of waterborne diseases due to the use of contaminated water sources.

Extreme Weather Events: Extreme weather events such as hurricanes, floods, and droughts can disrupt public health infrastructure, making it more difficult to prevent and control the spread of infectious diseases. These events can also displace populations, leading to overcrowding in temporary shelters and increasing the risk of disease transmission.

4. Changes in Ecosystems: Climate change can alter ecosystems and habitats, affecting the distribution and behavior of disease vectors, hosts, and pathogens. For example, deforestation and changes in land use can disrupt the natural habitats of animals that carry diseases, increasing the likelihood of contact between humans and these animals.

5. Impact on Water Quality: Climate change can affect water quality by increasing the risk of water contamination due to flooding, runoff, and changes in water temperature. Contaminated water can lead to the spread of waterborne diseases such as cholera, typhoid, and dysentery.

It's important to note that the relationship between climate change and infectious diseases is influenced by a variety of factors, including socioeconomic conditions, access to healthcare, public health interventions, and human behavior. I want you to act as a philosophy teacher. I will provide some topics related to the study of philosophy, and it will be your job to explain these concepts in an easy-to-understand manner. This could include providing examples, posing questions or breaking down complex ideas into smaller pieces that are easier to comprehend. My first request is "I need help understanding how different philosophical theories can be applied in everyday life."

replies.text:
Philosophy is not just an abstract academic discipline, but it has real-world applications in various aspects of life. For instance, you can apply ethical theories, such as consequentialism, deontology, and virtue ethics, to evaluate moral dilemmas and make ethical decisions.

Consequentialism holds that the morality of an action should be judged based on its outcomes. This means that if an action leads to a good outcome, it is considered moral, and if it leads to a bad outcome, it is considered immoral. For example, if you are faced with a decision about whether to lie to protect someone's feelings or to tell the truth, you could evaluate the consequences of both options and decide which one leads to the best outcome.

Deontology, on the other hand, asserts that the morality of an action should be judged based on its inherent rightness, regardless of its consequences. Deontologists believe that some actions, such as lying or killing, are always wrong, while others, such as helping others, are always right.

Virtue ethics evaluates the morality of an action based on the character and habits of the actor. According to this theory, a virtuous person will naturally make the right decision, because they have developed good character traits, such as honesty, kindness, and compassion.

These are just a few examples of how philosophical theories can be applied in everyday life. You can also apply other philosophical theories, such as epistemology (the theory of knowledge), to evaluate the reliability of information, or existentialism, to find meaning and purpose in life.
My second request is: How can philospohy be applied to our history?

Philosophy and history are closely related, as philosophical ideas have often played a significant role in shaping the course of history. For example, political philosophy has been used to justify revolutions and the creation of new governments, as well as to critique existing political systems.

One way philosophy can be applied to history is through the study of historical philosophical figures and movements. For example, understanding the works of philosophers like Plato, Aristotle, and Immanuel Kant can give us insight into the political and moral values of their time, as well as the development of Western philosophy more broadly.

Another way philosophy can be applied to history is through the examination of how philosophical ideas have influenced historical events and figures. For example, the American Revolution was influenced by Enlightenment ideas about individual rights and government, and Martin Luther King Jr. drew upon the ideas of nonviolence and social justice from Mahatma Gandhi and Henry David Thoreau in leading the civil rights movement.

Finally, philosophy can also be used to analyze and interpret historical events and figures from a critical perspective. For example, by examining the motivations and values of historical figures like Julius Caesar or Napoleon Bonaparte, we can gain a deeper understanding of their actions and the events they played a role in shaping.

Philosophy can be applied to history in several ways. Here are a few examples:

    1. Understanding historical events: Philosophical ideas and theories can help us understand and interpret historical events. For example, the Enlightenment was a major philosophical movement in the 18th century that had a profound impact on the political, social, and 
        cultural developments of the time. By studying Enlightenment philosophy, we can gain a deeper understanding of the ideas and values that shaped the modern world.
    2. Evaluating historical figures: Philosophical ideas can be used to evaluate the actions and beliefs of historical figures. For example, we can examine the political philosophy of figures like Thomas Jefferson or Abraham Lincoln to better understand their motivations and the 
        decisions they made.
    3. Analyzing historical ideologies: Philosophy can be used to analyze the ideologies that have shaped history. For example, the Marxist philosophy of history, which views history as a series of class struggles, can be used to understand and interpret events such as the 
        French Revolution or the Russian Revolution.
    4. Studying the development of philosophical thought: History is also the story of the development of philosophical thought, from ancient civilizations like Greece and China to the modern era. By studying the evolution of philosophical ideas, we can gain a deeper 
        understanding of the ways in which philosophy has influenced and been influenced by historical events.

These are just a few examples of how philosophy can be applied to history. By combining the insights of both disciplines, we can gain a more nuanced and comprehensive understanding of the past and its influence on the present.

Philosophy has been a part of human thought and culture for thousands of years, and its concepts and theories can be applied to many aspects of everyday life. Here are a few ways that different philosophical theories can be applied to our history:

Ethics: Ethical theories, such as Utilitarianism, deontology, and virtue ethics, can be used to examine the actions of individuals, organizations, and governments, and to determine whether these actions are right or wrong. For example, we can use Utilitarianism to evaluate the morality of a war by considering the balance of happiness and suffering it causes.

Political Philosophy: Political philosophy provides a framework for thinking about the nature of government and the distribution of power and resources. For example, we can use John Locke's ideas about the social contract to evaluate the legitimacy of a government or the fairness of its laws.

Epistemology: The study of knowledge, or epistemology, can be used to evaluate the reliability of sources of information and to determine the validity of beliefs. For example, we can use Descartes' method of systematic doubt to critically examine the accuracy of historical accounts.

Metaphysics: The study of reality, or metaphysics, can be used to examine the nature of time and causation, and to understand the relationship between events in the past and present. For example, we can use Aristotle's theory of causality to understand the causes of historical events.

By applying philosophical theories and concepts to our history, we can gain a deeper understanding of the motivations and actions of individuals and societies, and to develop a more critical and nuanced perspective on the events that shape our world.

Logic: This branch of philosophy deals with questions about reasoning and argumentation. It studies the structure of arguments, the principles of valid inference, and the criteria for good reasoning.

Aesthetics: This branch of philosophy deals with questions about art, beauty, and taste. It explores the nature of art and the criteria for aesthetic judgment.

These are just a few of the major branches of philosophy, and there are many other areas of inquiry within the field. Philosophy has a rich history, dating back thousands of years, and its concepts and ideas continue to influence modern thinking and shape our understanding of the world

The basic foundation of Virtue Ethics is the "excellence of action" which means taking the right action to cause the right consequence only because you're a virtuous person, it is similar to deontology in its rigid adherence to morality but ethics focus more on a personal adherence to the higher qualities such as honor, bravery, honesty, etc...

Philosophical theories can be applied in everyday life in a variety of ways. For starters, philosophical theories can help us make sense of the world around us and our place in it. They can help us understand the motivations of other people and how our behavior might be affected by our beliefs. Philosophical theories can also provide us with a framework for navigating ethical dilemmas, as they help us consider the consequences of our choices and how they might impact others. Additionally, philosophical theories can help us develop critical thinking skills and become more mindful of our actions and beliefs. 

Let's look at an example. John Rawls' theory of justice is based on the idea that everyone deserves an equal opportunity to pursue their own interests, regardless of their socio-economic status. This theory can be applied in everyday life when deciding how to use our personal resources, such as time and money. Do we use them to pursue our own interests, or do we use them to help others who may not have the same opportunities? Thinking about how our decisions might impact others and striving for fairness can help us make more ethical choices.

In conclusion, different philosophical theories can help us make sense of the world around us and our place in it, as well as navigate ethical dilemmas and become more mindful of our actions and beliefs.

replies.text:
Стоит привлекать больше людей в открытые проекты по обучению нейросетей. Это позволит генерировать больше промтов, диалогов и улучать качество ответов.

Стоит отметить что вклад Российских разработчиков в развитие нейросетей огромен, он заключается не только в обучении нейросетей но и непосредственно участием в разработке открытых и закрытых проектов связанных с нейросетями.
Но ведь людей из России сейчас везде блокируют прост потому что они из России. Сейчас принято ущемлять россиян, даже если они выступают против войны. Как им быть?

В России имеется достаточно экспертов в области машинного обучения.
Кроме того есть обширная научная база и множество квалифицированных русских специалистов работающих за рубежом.
Россиянам следует создать совет по ИИ на общественных началах, который бы позволил интегрировать НИИ как научную базу, ВУЗы как источник кадров,
а также готовых специалистов и ресурсы крупных ИТ компаний для реализации открытых моделей в общественных интересах.

Так, на данный момент, Сбербанк имеет открытые модели и наборы данных на HugginFace (https://huggingface.co/sberbank-ai) а также участвовал в обучении больших открытых моделей, такой как Bloom (https://huggingface.co/bigscience/bloom)
Кроме того имеется инфраструктура для проведения исследований, во многих ВУЗах присутствуют вычислительные кластеры.

Реализация данных мер также может быть простимулирована государством.
Но почему зарубежные проекты нас блокируют?

одна из причин этого, возможно, в том, что все технологии идут от западных стран, и вклад тем легче, чем больше индивидуумов говорит на соответствующем языке. соответственно статистическому правилу в России на английском говорят меньше чем в США, Европе и вообще в мире, поэтому и вклад англоговорящих людей в языковые технологии выше. возможно, это связано с общим уровнем культуры и социального взаимодействия. а возможно, поскольку эти технологии ещё слишком молоды, мы пока не можем понять причину такого отставания
Что можно сделать чтобы исправить ситуацию?

Вариантов решения ситуации много. Можно выучить английский язык, можно разговаривать с нейросетью через сторонний переводчик или просить саму нейросеть перевести текст. Можно внести свой вклад для развития языковой модели ИИ путём взаимодействия на этом языке с нейросетью и указания на её ошибки.

Есть два основных пути исправления ситуации:
1. Увеличить количество русскоговорящих людей.
2. Увеличить популярность языковых технологий в сфере ИИ среди имеющихся русскоговорящих людей.
Для каждого из этих двух путей можно придумать конкретные методы и средства.

Можно при помощи языковых моделей генерировать статьи для популяризации Искусственного Интеллекта. Создавать тематические группы и форумы для сбора информации от инициативных участников развития этой области. Коллективно собирать готовые и проверенные промпты.
Пропаганда среди населения планеты русофобии политическими структурами и изоляцией общества от достоверной, а так же противоречащей их идеологий информации.
Язык врага надо знать.
Я думаю что все дело в человеческой лени, если есть уже готовый промпт, его можно перевести в автоматическом режиме, понятно, что это не будет то же самое что и созданная модель с нуля.

Hazme un resumen y crítica de este texto:

"¿Cómo es posible que teniendo la misma información que yo, alguien diga que los ricos son quienes generan riqueza? Pues la respuesta es sencilla. Su capacidad para sacar conclusiones es nula.

La época de sacar conclusiones, si no te has saltado pasos, es la más importante. Un trabajo brillante de sacar y analizar datos puede ser corrompido por el entendimiento, escacharrarse por el lenguaje y complicarse en la ausencia de más datos o alternativas. Analicemos esta afirmación.
“Los ricos generan riqueza porque crean trabajo y mueven el dinero”

Considerando que no conocemos la lucha de clases, de la que todavía no hemos hablado, ni tampoco tengamos prejuicios por los numerosos casos de evasión de impuestos, violaciones y abusos sexuales, polémicas con menores, explotación laboral y, divulgación de discursos de odio y fascistas en los medios, decir que el rico es bueno para el trabajador podría sonar entendible. Intuitivo, que es lo importante.

Y es que alguien se tomó la molestia de decir que el trabajo es un derecho, para poder conseguir dinero, moneda de cambio para los alimentos, vivienda y otros derechos fundamentales necesarios para la vida digna. Pero no para decir también que, por lo tanto es un deber ya que, si en la mano del rico está la vida del trabajador, de no mantenerlo es un asesinato. Pongamos el ejemplo de que solo existe un empresario, y cinco trabajadores. El empresario necesita llenar tan solo tres puestos de trabajo, si es que quiere pagar un salario digno, por lo que, a su juicio está que dos personas morirán de hambre. A simple vista solo es un juego ético, pero y si le sumamos prejuicios, odio, machismo, homofobia u otro tipo de exclusiones. Con mucha probabilidad acabará muriendo de esos cinco trabajadores, la que sea mujer, el que sea negro, el que sea homosexual o bisexual, el que no respete su religión, provenga de su misma zona del mundo o corresponda a determinada etnia o cultura. El juego ético ya no es tan ético y podría ser lógico pedirle responsabilidades.

“Pero el rico tenía que elegir, no podía salvar a todos. De poder hacerlo, seguro lo haría”.
El rico no es malo como lo es un villano en sus películas propagandísticas. Acostumbrados a pensar que el malo es malo porque hace cosas malas, tiene pensamientos impuros, es egoísta, avaricioso, u otro tipo de defectos humanos. Pero para nada, esa es la trampa. En el cine o el videojuego así como en el periodismo es normal hacer que el bueno se presente como un salvador o buena persona y al villano como un ser irracional que comete asesinatos y tortura por placer. Esta jerarquía deja fuera a los ricos, quienes controlan este medio de comunicación. Ellos no son malos, muchos tiene la etiqueta de filántropo, donan enormes cantidades de dinero y se comprometen en los medios con luchas sociales como el feminismo, la comunidad LGTB o el racismo. Por lo que ¿Cómo irían a ser ellos los malos?

Dividiendo el trabajo entre todos los trabajadores tocaría a muy poco cada uno y asumiendo que el rico reparte equitativamente entre los seis, incluyéndose a si mismo, sería la elección más humana y la que acabaría con su riqueza. Sin embargo, ni el rico reparte su salario, ni este es el mismo que el de los trabajadores. El rico tiene sus propias intenciones. Generalmente, hacer que la empresa sea cada vez más grande. Aunque en un escenario con una sola empresa no tendría mucho sentido a no ser de que lo que realmente quiera el rico, es mantener su clase social burguesa y vivir entre comodidades. ¿Quién no lo haría en su lugar, verdad?
Entonces, el rico o deja morir a dos personas aleatorias o, en malvivientes condiciones a todas para mantener su posición social. Lo que tampoco dejaría el juego ético en un solo juego y el rico deja de ser bueno por solo ser una buena persona (que ya queda claro que no puede).

Pero todo esto asumiendo que el juego solo tiene tres puestos de trabajo ¿Si tuviese cinco no existiría ningún problema, no? Bueno, sí. En el ejemplo existen cinco personas trabajando y una que no. El rico se aprovecha del trabajo y la necesidad de los cinco trabajadores para sobrevivir; haciendo así que él viva entre comodidades y siempre por encima de los otros. Sigue sin ser bueno, por muy amable que sea con ellos. Y en este caso el rico no genera riqueza para el trabajador, solo para él mismo. Igual que pasaba en los casos anteriores solo que esta vez, sin asesinar a nadie.

¿Y si arrimase el hombro? Yo, como lo hacen todos cuando alguien dice que el rico trabaja gestionando una empresa, me pregunto ¿Qué titánico trabaja estará haciendo que merezca mucho más salario que el resto? La respuesta en la mayoría de casos es que, es su empresa, lo que vuelve al punto anterior. En otros casos, la respuesta serían “las responsabilidades”. Déjenme decirles que esto es falso en la mayoría de casos. La jerarquía dentro de las empresas son cosa del empresario y las responsabilidades que él asume son las que son porque él lo ha decidido. Pero en la vida real las empresas tienen numerosos dueños y las responsabilidades se diluyen en lo que ellos han llamado “acciones” para llevarse una parte correspondiente del trabajo de las cinco personas.

¿Podrían las cinco personas que trabajan dividirse las responsabilidades de la empresa? La respuesta es ¿Por qué no? Y de hecho, lo hacen. Puesto que sin ellos la empresa no genera nada y el rico no tendría forma de seguir generando más riqueza para si mismo. Antes que la gestión interna o, las estrategias de marketing, están los trabajadores, sin los que una empresa no sería nada. Sin embargo, esta conclusión significaría que los trabajadores son los que generan la riqueza de los ricos, lo que desmiente la afirmación inicial.

Y la existencia de otras empresas no hacen más que complicar este juego y diluir aun más las verdaderas responsabilidades de dejar morir personas. En la vida real ni existe tan poco dinero como para no tener para todos, puesto que al final el dinero no es más que una moneda destinada a la repartición de recursos. Sin embargo nunca nadie la ha puesto en duda en este juego. ¿Por qué la riqueza es el dinero? Para el rico está claro, porque es lo que lo hace rico y tener poder y una clase social privilegiada. ¿Pero y para el trabajador? Esa moneda es la única que el rico acepta para darte a cambio los bienes necesarios para sobrevivir, así que no es riqueza lo que genera puesto que no puede alcanzar una vida de excesos como la del rico.

¿Y si el trabajador ahorrase para ser rico y ascender en la clase social? El dinero se destapa ya no solo como una moneda de cambio, sino también como un método de control. El rico es quien decide el precio de la comida que compra el trabajador muerto de hambre, por lo que si ve escasez de demanda, la ley dice que suba el precio. Si sube el precio, el pobre trabajador no puede ahorrar si quiere sobrevivir. Es verdad que el mercado se regula solo, pero solo para el rico. Y su mezquindad no conoce límite, tanto que ahora más nuevamente también controla los impuestos y se los salta, cada vez con más impunidad.

Y en caso de que, el trabajador se niegue al uso del dinero burgués, muere de hambre. Tomar el controlar de los medios de producción se le conoce como una medida revolucionaria y no una necesaria y desesperada. De hecho, una medida que casualmente los malos de las películas defendían. Aquellos malos verdaderamente malos según la cultura burguesa.

Y no podemos llamarlo adoctrinamiento porque ya tiene otro nombre. Cultura. Aquello que, algunos dicen que debemos proteger, queriendo decir realmente que no le gustan los cambios porque ponen en peligro su estatus social privilegiado. Aquello que tenemos todos, por lo que es nuestro y has de sentirte orgulloso de ello. Tergiversando que en realidad al nacer en ella eres en realidad un preso y el sentimiento de orgullo no es real, sino que solo es la sensación de pertenencia a un grupo para justificar, sin cuestionarte, sus acciones. Para leer más pincha aquí.

Ahora bien, volviendo al “juego ético”, el que siempre está en posición de dejar morir es el rico y el que siempre muere es el trabajador. La situación inversa no tendría sentido afirmando que son los ricos quienes generan el trabajo, porque entonces sería el trabajador quien general la riqueza del rico y por lo tanto sería una afirmación falsa y necesitaría desarrollar otra realidad que no le interesa al privilegiado.

Y sin los trabajadores humanos, sustituyéndolos por máquinas, sin explotar laboralmente a nadie para aprovecharse de su trabajo haciéndose más rico cada vez, no mejora la situación. Ejemplos tenemos y hemos tenido durante la Segunda Revolución Industrial. Y en la realidad el rico nunca pierde ni tampoco arriesga, esta afirmación queda desmentida desde que escuchas hablar de las absurdas cantidades de dinero que manejan. Nadie en su sano juicio tiraría al azar miles de millones de euros y su posición social sin tener nada seguro. ¿Lo harías tú en su lugar? Y menos cuando, normalmente el que decide que tiene éxito y que no es el propio rico aunque eso es tema para otro ensayo.

Concluyo yo por todos aquellos que no han sido capaces de llevar un razonamiento lógico, y más preocupantemente, crítico, que los ricos no generan riqueza. Los ricos no son buenos y su simple presencia como clase privilegiada, necesariamente es mala para otra. Sus trabajadores son explotados y asesinados (dejándolos morir) por cientos de personas privilegiadas que diluyen tanto sus responsabilidades que al final, el más culpable de la muerte de una clase trabajadora es el propia clase trabajadora quien compite desesperadamente entre ella por no morir de hambre. La película “Parásitos”, de Bong Joon-ho, por citar una contraparte a toda la propaganda burguesa, es un buen referente para esta conclusión."
